defs.docs: Async synchronization primitives.

attributes.value: / This crate provides the following primitives:
/ * [`Barrier`] - enables tasks to synchronize all together at the same time.
/ * [`RwLock`] - a reader-writer lock, allowing any number of readers or a single writer.
/ * [`Semaphore`] - limits the number of concurrent operations.

defs.name: Barrier
defs.docs: A counter to synchronize multiple tasks at the same time.

attributes.value: / A counter to synchronize multiple tasks at the same time.

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Creates a barrier that can block the given number of tasks.

attributes.value: / Creates a barrier that can block the given number of tasks.
/ A barrier will block `n`-1 tasks which call [`wait()`] and then wake up all tasks
/ at once when the `n`th task calls [`wait()`].

defs.name: wait
defs.value: pub async fn wait<'_>(&'_ Self) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Blocks the current task until all tasks reach this point.

attributes.value: / Blocks the current task until all tasks reach this point.
/ Barriers are reusable after all tasks have synchronized, and can be used continuously.
/ Returns a [`BarrierWaitResult`] indicating whether this task is the "leader", meaning the
/ last task to call this method.
/             // The same messages will be printed together.
/             // There will NOT be interleaving of "before" and "after".

defs.name: BarrierWaitResult
defs.docs: Returned by [`Barrier::wait()`] when all tasks have called it.

attributes.value: / Returned by [`Barrier::wait()`] when all tasks have called it.

defs.name: is_leader
defs.docs: Returns `true` if this task was the last to call to [`Barrier::wait()`].

attributes.value: / Returns `true` if this task was the last to call to [`Barrier::wait()`].

defs.name: Mutex
defs.docs: An async mutex.

attributes.value: / The locking mechanism uses eventual fairness to ensure locking will be fair on average without
/ sacrificing performance. This is done by forcing a fair lock whenever a lock operation is

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Creates a new async mutex.

defs.name: into_inner
defs.docs: Consumes the mutex, returning the underlying data.

attributes.value: / Consumes the mutex, returning the underlying data.

defs.name: lock
defs.value: pub async fn lock<'_, '_>(&'_ Self) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Acquires the mutex.

attributes.value: / Returns a guard that releases the mutex when dropped.

defs.name: try_lock
defs.docs: Attempts to acquire the mutex.

attributes.value: / If the mutex could not be acquired at this time, then [`None`] is returned. Otherwise, a
/ guard is returned that releases the mutex when dropped.

defs.name: get_mut
defs.docs: Returns a mutable reference to the underlying data.

attributes.value: / Returns a mutable reference to the underlying data.
/ Since this call borrows the mutex mutably, no actual locking takes place -- the mutable
/ borrow statically guarantees the mutex is not already acquired.

defs.name: lock_arc
defs.docs: Acquires the mutex and clones a reference to it.

attributes.value: / Acquires the mutex and clones a reference to it.
/ Returns an owned guard that releases the mutex when dropped.

defs.name: try_lock_arc
defs.docs: Attempts to acquire the mutex and clone a reference to it.

attributes.value: / Attempts to acquire the mutex and clone a reference to it.
/ If the mutex could not be acquired at this time, then [`None`] is returned. Otherwise, an
/ owned guard is returned that releases the mutex when dropped.

defs.name: MutexGuard
defs.docs: A guard that releases the mutex when dropped.

attributes.value: / A guard that releases the mutex when dropped.

defs.name: source
defs.docs: Returns a reference to the mutex a guard came from.

attributes.value: / Returns a reference to the mutex a guard came from.

defs.name: MutexGuardArc
defs.docs: An owned guard that releases the mutex when dropped.

attributes.value: / An owned guard that releases the mutex when dropped.

defs.docs: Returns a reference to the mutex a guard came from.

attributes.value: / Returns a reference to the mutex a guard came from.

defs.name: RwLock
defs.docs: An async reader-writer lock.

attributes.value: / This type of lock allows multiple readers or one writer at any point in time.
/ The locking strategy is write-preferring, which means writers are never starved.
/ Releasing a write lock wakes the next blocked reader and the next blocked writer.
/ // Multiple read locks can be held at a time.
/ // Only one write lock can be held at a time.

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Creates a new reader-writer lock.

defs.name: into_inner
defs.docs: Unwraps the lock and returns the inner value.

attributes.value: / Unwraps the lock and returns the inner value.

defs.name: try_read
defs.docs: Attempts to acquire a read lock.

attributes.value: / Attempts to acquire a read lock.
/ If a read lock could not be acquired at this time, then [`None`] is returned. Otherwise, a
/ guard is returned that releases the lock when dropped.

defs.name: read
defs.value: pub async fn read<'_, '_>(&'_ Self) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Acquires a read lock.

attributes.value: / Returns a guard that releases the lock when dropped.
/ Note that attempts to acquire a read lock will block if there are also concurrent attempts

defs.name: try_upgradable_read
defs.docs: Attempts to acquire a read lock with the possiblity to upgrade to a write lock.

attributes.value: / Attempts to acquire a read lock with the possiblity to upgrade to a write lock.
/ If a read lock could not be acquired at this time, then [`None`] is returned. Otherwise, a
/ guard is returned that releases the lock when dropped.
/ Upgradable read lock reserves the right to be upgraded to a write lock, which means there
/ can be at most one upgradable read lock at a time.

defs.name: upgradable_read
defs.value: pub async fn upgradable_read<'_, '_>(&'_ Self) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Attempts to acquire a read lock with the possiblity to upgrade to a write lock.

attributes.value: / Attempts to acquire a read lock with the possiblity to upgrade to a write lock.
/ Returns a guard that releases the lock when dropped.
/ Upgradable read lock reserves the right to be upgraded to a write lock, which means there
/ can be at most one upgradable read lock at a time.
/ Note that attempts to acquire an upgradable read lock will block if there are concurrent
/ attempts to acquire another upgradable read lock or a write lock.

defs.name: try_write
defs.docs: Attempts to acquire a write lock.

attributes.value: / Attempts to acquire a write lock.
/ If a write lock could not be acquired at this time, then [`None`] is returned. Otherwise, a
/ guard is returned that releases the lock when dropped.

defs.docs: Acquires a write lock.

attributes.value: / Returns a guard that releases the lock when dropped.

/ Since this call borrows the lock mutably, no actual locking takes place. The mutable borrow

defs.name: RwLockReadGuard
defs.docs: A guard that releases the read lock when dropped.

attributes.value: / A guard that releases the read lock when dropped.

defs.name: RwLockUpgradableReadGuard
defs.docs: A guard that releases the upgradable read lock when dropped.

attributes.value: / A guard that releases the upgradable read lock when dropped.

defs.name: downgrade
defs.docs: Downgrades into a regular reader guard.

attributes.value: / Downgrades into a regular reader guard.

defs.name: try_upgrade
defs.docs: Attempts to upgrade into a write lock.

attributes.value: / Attempts to upgrade into a write lock.
/ If a write lock could not be acquired at this time, then [`None`] is returned. Otherwise,
/ an upgraded guard is returned that releases the write lock when dropped.
/ This function can only fail if there are other active read locks.

defs.name: upgrade
defs.docs: Upgrades into a write lock.

defs.name: Semaphore
defs.docs: A counter for limiting the number of concurrent operations.

attributes.value: / A counter for limiting the number of concurrent operations.

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Creates a new semaphore with a limit of `n` concurrent operations.

attributes.value: / Creates a new semaphore with a limit of `n` concurrent operations.

defs.name: try_acquire
defs.docs: Attempts to get a permit for a concurrent operation.

attributes.value: / Attempts to get a permit for a concurrent operation.
/ If the permit could not be acquired at this time, then [`None`] is returned. Otherwise, a
/ guard is returned that releases the mutex when dropped.

defs.name: acquire
defs.value: pub async fn acquire<'_, '_>(&'_ Self) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Waits for a permit for a concurrent operation.

attributes.value: / Waits for a permit for a concurrent operation.
/ Returns a guard that releases the permit when dropped.

defs.docs: Attempts to get an owned permit for a concurrent operation.

attributes.value: / A guard that releases the acquired permit.
